author: Dentons
title: ECB publishes ESCB reports on facilitating CCP access
text:
ECB publishes ESCB reports on facilitating CCP access more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=12a4ea99-aea1-45ef-be86-b832eec30da5" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
ECB has published the contribution of the European System of Central Banks (ESCB) to the Commission’s assessment of the need for any measure to be introduced in European Market Infrastructure Regulation (EMIR) to facilitate Central Counterparties’ (CCPs) access to central bank liquidity facilities. ESCB reports that introducing such requirements in EMIR would not be appropriate and that the existing legal framework is adequate for ensuring effective CCP access to central bank facilities. The current framework is such that national central banks are free to provide CCPs with access to central bank facilities when they deem this to be appropriate with regard to their mandates. (Source: ESCB Report on the Need for any Measure to Facilitate CCPs Access to Central Bank Liquidity Facilities )
